wikipedia_page.main:
(Charles) Norman Haseldine (25 March 1922 – 16 October 1998) was a British Labour Co-operative politician.  Born in Sheffield, he served as Member of Parliament for Bradford West from 1966 until his defeat at the 1970 general election by the Conservative candidate John Wilkinson.
He married the former Georgette Elise Michelle Bernard in 1946: their four sons were Michael (born 1947), Gerald (born 1948), Paul (born 1955) and Luke (born 1965).

link_mentions.page: List of MPs elected in the 1966 United Kingdom general election

response: Arthur Tiley (17 January 1910 – 5 June 1994) was a British businessman and Conservative and National Liberal politician. Upon the re-creation of the Bradford West constituency in 1955, Tiley was elected as its Member of Parliament. He held the seat until his defeat at the 1966 general election by Labour's Norman Haseldine. He was the MP for Bradford during the city's smallpox outbreak in 1962.

He was Conservative and National Liberal politician. Upon the re-creation of the Bradford West constituency in 1955, Tiley was elected as its Member of Parliament. He held the seat until his defeat at the 1966 general election by Labour's Norman Haseldine.
